headline.main: Food Drops Go Awry, Damaging Several Homes

lead_paragraph: The planes would bring gifts from the sky, 2-year-old Mohebrahman Sedigh kept saying when American planes began bombing near here. He meant food. The gifts finally came early this morning, in the form of Pop-Tarts, peanut butter and other food rations. But they also inadvertently brought more hardship.
abstract: Several wooden crates full of relief food, dropped by parachute from American planes, smash into at least four houses in village near Herat, Afghanistan; no is hurt; parachute and food crate also damage centuries-old shrine; photo (M)
